results.title: Achille's heel
results.brief_description: Sucked in by advertising that promises to make him irrestible to women, hapless Henry rushes out to buy the latest gimmick - a pair of ‘Cyberguy’ rocket boots. In his haste to try them out the second he gets back to his apartment, he ignores the safety warnings, with disastrous results.

results.title: Achieving sexual maturity
results.creator_credit: John Wiley and Sons, FilmFair Communications and Ben Norman
results.brief_description: The film deals with the sexual anatomy, physiology and behaviour of both sexes from conception to adulthood. It uses explicit live photography of nude males and females to explain external sexual anatomy - and graphics and diagrams for internal anatomy. It moves, in order through conception embryonic development, early childhood puberty, adolescence and adulthood. The film describes ovulation and menstruation in girls, ejaculation in boys and treats masturbation as a normal sexual activity in both sexes. At appropriate times through out the film, young people express spontaneous feelings and tell of individual experiences.

results.title: Achievement in Hong Kong
results.brief_description: The life of the Chinese population of Hong Kong and the emergency housing scheme. The history of the colony; the Chinese tradition; the disastrous fire of Christmas 1953 and the subsequent establishment of the Government Resettlement Department. Progress on the rehousing scheme, building large concrete blocks of emergency dwellings, to be converted into permanent flats as conditions improve. Cinematographer: Julius Evans

results.title: Achievement
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Crusader Cloth Pty Ltd, Jean Halliday and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: The story of the Australian wool industry. The success of this industry and its importance to the Australian economy is dependent on the work of many people; the sheep breedere, the boundary rider, the wool classer, the broker, and the skilled operatives converting fibre to cloth, all play their part.

results.title: Achieve with honor
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Helms Athletic Foundation, this film gives a history of the Olympic Games, from the first Olympiad of the modern era at Athens in 1896 until the 11th Olympiad in Berlin in 1936. Presents and reiterates the notion that winning is less important than competing well but then, however, goes on to recount a list of victorious athletes from past Olympics. Narrated by Bill Henry.

results.title: Accountancy today!
results.brief_description: A career film. An Accountant needs an inquiring mind and the ability to communicate effectively; he must collect and record facts, analyse them, prepare reports, discuss financial implications, control their results. After a three year full-time course of study at a university or technical college, he can gain employment in a secure, well-paid position which may lead to promotion to top executive positions in commerce, industry, government departments or private practice.
